title: DOJ Petitions Congress to Curb Legal Protections for Internet Companies
text: The proposal could remove long-standing protections for online platforms.

title: Facebook Threatens to Shoot Itself in the Foot
text: The social networking giant really doesn't want to stop sending user data to the U.S.

title: The Wall Street Journal: DOJ to seek Congressional curbs on immunity for internet companies
text: The Justice Department will submit a proposal to Congress on Wednesday to curb longstanding legal protections for internet companies such as Facebook Inc.

title: Facebook and YouTube accept hate speech audits to keep advertisers happy
text: Facebook, YouTube and Twitter have agreed to allow outsiders to audit how they handle harmful content such as hate speech following a boycott of their platforms by major advertisers.

title: Facebook will let Trump run ads on election night prematurely claiming victory
text: Facebook banned political ads a week before the election, but it’s the period after the election that it should be worried about. Here’s why.

title: Facebook denies it will pull service in Europe over data transfer ban
text: Facebook’s head of global policy has denied the tech giant could close its service to Europeans if local regulators order it to suspend data transfers to the US following a landmark Court of Justice ruling in July that has cemented the schism between US surveillance laws and EU privacy rights. Press reports emerged this week […]

title: Advertisers agree deal with social media on steps to curb harmful content
text: Facebook, YouTube and Twitter have agreed with big advertisers on first steps to curb harmful content online, following boycotts of social media platforms that advertisers had accused of tolerating hate speech.

title: Facebook, Twitter, YouTube Make Peace With Advertisers Over Harmful Content: FT
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB), Twitter Inc (NYSE: TWTR), and Alphabet Inc’s (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) online video platform Youtube have reconciled with big advertisers over harmful content, according to a Financial Times report.

title: Facebook Removes Chinese Propaganda Network Trying To Influence US Presidential Election
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) said Tuesday it removed a network of fake accounts that spread propaganda and disinformation on China’s claims over the South China Sea and surrounding geography in the United States and Southeast Asia.
